00178 /*_____ M A C R O S ________________________________________________________*/
00179 /* little-big endian management */
00180 #define INTEL_ALIGNMENT     LITTLE_ENDIAN
00181 #define MOTOROLA_ALIGNMENT  BIG_ENDIAN
00182 
00183 // U16/U32 endian handlers
00184 #ifdef LITTLE_ENDIAN     // => 16bit: (LSB,MSB), 32bit: (LSW,MSW) or (LSB0,LSB1,LSB2,LSB3) or (MSB3,MSB2,MSB1,MSB0)
00185 #  define MSB(u16)        (((U8* )&u16)[1])
00186 #  define LSB(u16)        (((U8* )&u16)[0])
00187 #  define MSW(u32)        (((U16*)&u32)[1])
00188 #  define LSW(u32)        (((U16*)&u32)[0])
00189 #  define MSB0(u32)       (((U8* )&u32)[3])
00190 #  define MSB1(u32)       (((U8* )&u32)[2])
00191 #  define MSB2(u32)       (((U8* )&u32)[1])
00192 #  define MSB3(u32)       (((U8* )&u32)[0])
00193 #  define LSB0(u32)       MSB3(u32)
00194 #  define LSB1(u32)       MSB2(u32)
00195 #  define LSB2(u32)       MSB1(u32)
00196 #  define LSB3(u32)       MSB0(u32)
00197 #else // BIG_ENDIAN         => 16bit: (MSB,LSB), 32bit: (MSW,LSW) or (LSB3,LSB2,LSB1,LSB0) or (MSB0,MSB1,MSB2,MSB3)
00198 #  define MSB(u16)        (((U8* )&u16)[0])
00199 #  define LSB(u16)        (((U8* )&u16)[1])
00200 #  define MSW(u32)        (((U16*)&u32)[0])
00201 #  define LSW(u32)        (((U16*)&u32)[1])
00202 #  define MSB0(u32)       (((U8* )&u32)[0])
00203 #  define MSB1(u32)       (((U8* )&u32)[1])
00204 #  define MSB2(u32)       (((U8* )&u32)[2])
00205 #  define MSB3(u32)       (((U8* )&u32)[3])
00206 #  define LSB0(u32)       MSB3(u32)
00207 #  define LSB1(u32)       MSB2(u32)
00208 #  define LSB2(u32)       MSB1(u32)
00209 #  define LSB3(u32)       MSB0(u32)
00210 #endif
00211 
00212 // Endian converters
00213 #define Le16(b)                        \
00214    (  ((U16)(     (b) &   0xFF) << 8)  \
00215    |  (     ((U16)(b) & 0xFF00) >> 8)  \
00216    )
00217 #define Le32(b)                             \
00218    (  ((U32)(     (b) &       0xFF) << 24)  \
00219    |  ((U32)((U16)(b) &     0xFF00) <<  8)  \
00220    |  (     ((U32)(b) &   0xFF0000) >>  8)  \
00221    |  (     ((U32)(b) & 0xFF000000) >> 24)  \
00222    )
00223 
00224 // host to network conversion: used for Intel HEX format, TCP/IP, ...
00225 // Convert a 16-bit value from host-byte order to network-byte order
00226 // Standard Unix, POSIX 1003.1g (draft)
00227 
00228 #ifdef LITTLE_ENDIAN
00229 #  define htons(a)    Le16(a)
00230 #define ntohs(a)    htons(a)
00231 #  define htonl(a)    Le32(a)
00232 #define ntohl(a)    htonl(a)
00233 #else
00234 #define htons(a)    (a)
00235 #define ntohs(a)    (a)
00236 #define htonl(a)    (a)
00237 #define ntohl(a)    (a)
00238 #endif

00243 #define ENABLED  1
00244 #define DISABLED 0
00245 #define DISABLE  0

00247 #define TRUE    (1==1)

00249 #define false   FALSE

00256 #ifndef NULL
00257 #define NULL    0

00260 #define CLR     0
00261 #define SET     1

00264 /* Bit and bytes manipulations */
00265 #define LOW(U16)                ((Uchar)U16)
00266 #define HIGH(U16)               ((Uchar)(U16>>8))
00267 #define TST_BIT_X(addrx,mask)   (*addrx & mask)
00268 #define SET_BIT_X(addrx,mask)   (*addrx = (*addrx | mask))
00269 #define CLR_BIT_X(addrx,mask)   (*addrx = (*addrx & ~mask))
00270 #define OUT_X(addrx,value)      (*addrx = value)
00271 #define IN_X(addrx)             (*addrx)
00272 
00273 #  define Max(a, b)            ( (a)>(b) ? (a) : (b) )       // Take the max between a and b
00274 #  define Min(a, b)            ( (a)<(b) ? (a) : (b) )       // Take the min between a and b
00275 
00276 // Align on the upper value <val> on a <n> boundary
00277 // i.e. Upper(0, 4)= 4
00278 //      Upper(1, 4)= 4
00279 //      Upper(2, 4)= 4
00280 //      Upper(3, 4)= 4
00281 //      Upper(4, 4)= 8
00282 //      ../..
00283 #  define Upper(val, n)        ( ((val)+(n)) & ~((n)-1) )
00284 
00285 // Align up <val> on a <n> boundary
00286 // i.e. Align_up(0, 4)= 0
00287 //      Align_up(1, 4)= 4
00288 //      Align_up(2, 4)= 4
00289 //      Align_up(3, 4)= 4
00290 //      Align_up(4, 4)= 4
00291 //      ../..
00292 #  define Align_up(val, n)     ( ((val)+(n)-1) & ~((n)-1) )
00293 
00294 // Align down <val> on a <n> boundary
00295 // i.e. Align_down(0, 4)= 0
00296 //      Align_down(1, 4)= 0
00297 //      Align_down(2, 4)= 0
00298 //      Align_down(3, 4)= 0
00299 //      Align_down(4, 4)= 4
00300 //      ../..
00301 #  define Align_down(val, n)   (  (val)        & ~((n)-1) )
00302 
00303 /*M**************************************************************************
00304 * NAME: Long_call
00305 *----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00306 * PARAMS:
00307 * addr: address of the routine to call
00308 *----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00309 * PURPOSE:
00310 * Call the routine at address addr: generate an Assembly LCALL addr opcode.
00311 *----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00312 * EXAMPLE:
00313 * Long_call(0); // Software reset (if no IT used before)
00314 *----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00315 * NOTE:
00316 * May be used as a long jump opcode in some special cases
00317 *****************************************************************************/
00318 #define Long_call(addr)         ((*(void (_ConstType_*)(void))(addr))())
00319 
00320 /* {For Langdoc} */
00321 
00322 /***********************************************************
00323  SET_SFR_BIT macro
00324   parameters
00325     sfr_reg : defined value in include file for sfr register
00326     bit_pos : defined value B_XX in include file for particular
00327               bit of sfr register
00328     bit_val : CLR / SET
00329 ************************************************************/
00330 #define SET_SFR_BIT(sfr_reg, bit_pos, bit_val) { sfr_reg &= ~(1<<(bit_pos)); sfr_reg |= ((bit_val)<<(bit_pos));}
00331 
00332 /***********************************************************
00333  bit_is_clear macro
00334   parameters
00335     PORT     : defined value in include file for sfr register
00336     POSITION : defined value in include file for particular
00337               bit of sfr register
00338   example : if (bit_is_clear(PORTB,PORTB3)) ...
00339 ************************************************************/
00340 #define bit_is_clear(PORT,POSITION) ((PORT & (1<<POSITION)) == 0 )
00341 
00342 /***********************************************************
00343  bit_is_set macro
00344   parameters
00345     PORT     : defined value in include file for sfr register
00346     POSITION : defined value in include file for particular
00347               bit of sfr register
00348   example : if (bit_is_set(PORTB,PORTB3)) ...
00349 ************************************************************/
00350 #define bit_is_set(PORT,POSITION) ((PORT & (1<<POSITION)) != 0 )

00356 #define TID_GUARD(proc) ((__TID__ & 0x7FF0) != ((90 << 8) | ((proc) << 4)))
